definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Therefore, Keep its essence and discard its dross in the course of the study.
sentences.chinese: 對《顏氏家訓》研究要取其精華，去其糟粕。

sentences.english: The forth part discusses the Yan's Family Precepts' influence to posterity.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分論述了《顏氏家訓》對後世的影響。

sentences.english: Once in the "Harvard family motto" let the rabbit on the run saw a fable.
sentences.chinese: 曾經在《哈佛家訓》上看過一則讓兔子奔跑的寓言。

sentences.english: Chinese traditional parental instruction owns a long history, it is abundant in content.
sentences.chinese: 中國傳統家訓源遠流長，內容豐富。

sentences.english: The family precepts are important documents expressing the economic concepts of the traditional Chinese family.
sentences.chinese: 家訓是傳統家庭表達經濟觀念的重要文獻。

sentences.english: Part III Advice of family and rule of ship.
"Tolerate to others, discipline myself" was also a teaching from him.
sentences.chinese: “與人爲善，嚴於律己”是祖父教導的家訓。

definition: friendly/amicable/to keep up harmonious relations (with sb)
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
A New Account of the Tales of the World, collection of anecdotes, conversations, remarks etc of historic personalities, compiled and edited by Liu Yiqing 劉義慶|刘义庆[Liu2 Yi4 qing4]
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
